node.title: New Caledonians will decide today whether they want to stay with France. Here's why Australians should care
node.alt: French President Emmanuel Macron wearing flowers around neck poses for selfie with Polynesian woman in sunglasses in crowd
node.description: New Caledonians will have their say on whether they want independence from France with the third and final referendum today — only this time, pro-independence supporters aren't planning to show up.
node.content:
["New Caledonians will have their\u00a0say on whether they want independence\u00a0from France with the third and final referendum today \u2014 only this time,\u00a0pro-independence supporters\u00a0aren't planning to show up.", "The indigenous Kanak population \u2014 who are largely pro-independence \u2014 decided to abstain because they have been in a 12-month mourning period after the surge in Delta cases in September.", "Their community bore the brunt of the French territory's COVID-19 deaths.", "Former consul-general in New Caledonia Denise Fisher said Kanak\u00a0mourning rites\u00a0were extensive, even for the loss of one community member, let alone almost 300.", "", "
Denise Fisher says Indigenous Kanaks\u00a0are observing 12 months of mourning after a large number of people died from COVID-19.(Supplied: Denise Fisher)
", "\"So, they asked France if they would defer that vote.\"", "Voting\u00a0isn't\u00a0mandatory and, legally, France can push\u00a0ahead with today's referendum, but the decision to do so\u00a0in light of the Kanaks' requests, has prompted\u00a0pro-independence groups to\u00a0abstain from the vote in protest.", "The margin between the results of the first and second referendum narrowed, with 43 per cent of votes for\u00a0independence\u00a0in\u00a02018 increasing to 47 per cent in 2020 and\u00a0the\u00a0gap was expected to close further at the third\u00a0poll.", "If independence voters don't turn up, there will likely be a landslide vote to remain with France.\u00a0", "", "
Today's referendum\u00a0is expected to be a far cry from the huge voter turnout seen in 2018 and 2020.(AP:\u00a0Mathurin Dere)
", "The pro-independence\u00a0movement\u00a0says it will contest the result's legitimacy, making what was supposed to be a conclusive end to a 23-year-old peace deal,\u00a0anything but.", "So, why is this referendum a\u00a0big deal?\u00a0How likely could this lead to unrest?\u00a0And why does the result matter to Australia?", "
Why is this referendum\u00a0significant?
", "New Caledonia is an\u00a0archipelago\u00a0about 1,500\u00a0kilometres east of Brisbane, with a population of approximately 300,000,\u00a0and has been a French territory\u00a0for 168 years.", "", "
New Caledonia's capital, Noumea, is a loyalist stronghold.(Flickr: Sharon and Peter Komidar)
", "Today's vote\u00a0is the last of three referenda\u00a0that can be requested under the Noumea Accord, which is\u00a0a peace agreement signed in 1998 following\u00a0bloody conflict that pitted pro-independence groups, French loyalists\u00a0and the French state against each other in the 1980s.", "It ended in what is referred to as the \"\u00c9v\u00e9nements\"\u2014 or the Events in English \u2014 which included a mass killing in 1988.", "Kanak militants seized a military post on a commune called Ouv\u00e9a, killing four French officers and taking\u00a027 hostage,\u00a0former ABC correspondent Max Uechtritz wrote\u00a0in his book Blood on\u00a0their Banner.\u00a0", "The militants demanded that a\u00a0referendum on self-determination be negotiated under the United Nations' supervision and \"threatened to kill their hostages if their demands were not met\", Uechtritz wrote.", "", "
Kanak leaders had\u00a0asked France to defer the vote but it will go ahead today.
", "At the time, the French rescue operation saw 19 Kanak militants and two French soldiers\u00a0killed in a cave on\u00a0Ouv\u00e9a.", "The\u00a0Noumea Accord was, in essence, a promise by the French Republic to grant increased political power to New Caledonia and its Kanak population.\u00a0", "It recognised, for the first time, the impact of colonisation on the Kanak people and outlined a 20-year transition period before three referenda\u00a0on self-determination would take place.", "
Who are the main players?
", "", "
France is\u00a0supposed to stay impartial in the referendum process.(AP: Mathurin Derel)
", "On one side,\u00a0loyalist voters say that staying with France would provide stability and security to the country and argue that, if France left, foreign powers such as\u00a0China would try to take its place.", "Carl N'guela, an\u00a0elected municipal representative and president of the polling station in the Mont-Dore commune, said\u00a0he\u00a0planned\u00a0to\u00a0vote to stay with France.", "The 30-year-old said\u00a0the reasons were \"too long to list\" but chief among them were the benefits of French nationality and a French passport, the security that France offered through the police forces and army, and accessibility to education and health services.", "", "
Carl\u00a0N'Guela says France offers security for New Caledonia.(ABC news: Patrick Nicar )
", "Ms Fisher said loyalists were also keen to see the vote go ahead as soon as possible.\u00a0", "\"They want a speedy vote because they say, 'Look, let's have it quickly because the economy is stagnating, so much uncertainty, investment has left the place, we really want to get things back on an even keel',\" Ms Fisher said.", "Kanak politician Patricia Goa said\u00a0independence would acknowledge the sovereignty of her community and would be a move towards decolonising New Caledonia.\u00a0", "", "
Patricia Goa says\u00a0\"colonialism must disappear\".(Supplied)
", "Ms Goa said the importance of independence and sovereignty outweighed\u00a0the alleged benefits of France's presence in the territory.", "\"No matter how much money you're going to put into this country, no matter how much effort you put into this country \u2026\u00a0as long as we are one Kanak, we will still call for freedom, sovereignty and independence,\" she said.", "\"The fact of colonialism must disappear.\"", "Then there is France, which is\u00a0supposed to stay impartial and has\u00a0made\u00a0a point of not commenting publicly ahead of major electoral processes.", "However, Ms\u00a0Fisher said, while Paris had managed to stay impartial for the first two votes, that's changed this time around.", "\"[There]\u00a0has been a little bit more nudging towards a vote to stay with France and there are numerous examples,\" she said.", "Ms Fisher said the French government was\u00a0obligated to issue materials\u00a0on how to vote, but this year it was \"pretty much a loyalist campaign brochure\u00a0and, in fact, the loyalists are\u00a0using it as a campaign brochure\".", "", "
Alexandre Dayant says in failing to remain impartial, France risks undermining the Noumea Accord.(Supplied: Alexandre Dayant)
", "Alexandre Dayant, a development economist for Asia and the Pacific at the Lowy Institute, expressed similar sentiments.\u00a0", "\"It seems that in this third iteration of the referendum, the French government is losing this impartiality,\" he said.", "\"It's a misstep by the French government that clearly undermines the whole referendum process and the Noumea Accord.\"", "He said domestic elections had a role to play.\u00a0", "\"French President Emmanuel Macron is facing a tough re-election campaign next year and he needs to show the French people that he's trying to keep the country as unified as possible,\" Mr Dayant said.", "The ABC approached France's Minister of Overseas Territories, Sebastien Lecornu, for comment but did not receive a response by deadline.", "However, a spokesman for the minister told Reuters that France would \"draw conclusions from this non-participation, which is a very strong message sent by the pro-independence supporters, but this non-participation will not override or cancel the result of the three referendums\".", "The French embassy in Australia\u00a0said it would not comment so close to the referendum.", "
Could the referendum be followed by unrest?
", "It's happened before\u00a0and experts warn it could happen again.", "Ms Fisher described a similar situation during a 1987 referendum on independence when Kanak leaders called for a boycott of the vote.", "\"The result was a predictable 98\u00a0per cent for staying with France because only the loyalists turned out,\" she said.", "\"And, only months later, the already existing violent protests that were taking place, escalated.\"", "Last month, a group of 64 Pacific experts\u00a0from around the world, including Ms Fisher, wrote an opinion piece in\u00a0the French newspaper, Le Monde, urging the French government to postpone the final vote.", "In it, they argued that a referendum on New Caledonia's future without the participation of the Kanak community was a \"flashback that evokes the dark hours of the \u00c9v\u00e9nements of 1984-1988\".\u00a0", "\"There was basically a civil war,\" Ms Fisher said.", "Additionally, France is reported to have deployed 2,000 military personnel to New Caledonia for the vote.", "
Why does all this matter to Australia?
", "The developments in New Caledonia matter because it is in Australia's interests that the Pacific remains a \"stable and peaceful\" region, Mr Dayant said, referencing Australia's role in\u00a0quelling conflict in the Solomon Islands in 2003.", "\"We can't say that what happened in the Solomon Islands would be reproduced in New Caledonia but \u2026\u00a0there is a risk that there is some unrest and I think Australia needs to remain attentive and be careful of what's happening.\"", "Ms Fisher said Australia, alongside other\u00a0regional Melaneisan and Pacific Island Forum Countries, including New Zealand, was interested in a peaceful outcome.", "\"Australia would take no position on the outcome of any vote \u2026\u00a0or on the date of the referendum, but Australia would expect a peaceful, transparent and credible referendum,\" Ms Fisher said.", "France has identified itself as a\u00a0Indo-Pacific partner and\u00a0significant ally in the region, Ms Fisher said.", "\"Since it stopped nuclear testing in French Polynesia\u00a0and since it negotiated agreements like the ones that are just coming to an end, the Pacific Islands have welcomed France as a constructive regional partner.\u00a0", "\"And, for Australia, this is extremely significant to have a strong, resourced, constructive Western ally in the region.\"", "", "
France has territories across the Pacific.\u00a0(ABC News: Jarrod Fankhauser)
", "Mr Dayant\u00a0said that\u00a0\u2014\u00a0with four territories,\u00a0560,000 French citizens and almost\u00a03,000 military personnel \u2014\u00a0France has a significant presence in the Pacific.", "He said its territories \u2014 New Caledonia, Wallis-and-Futuna, French Polynesia and Clipperton \u2014 gave France \"naval and economic advantages\" and \"allow Paris to project power across the region\".", "New Caledonia is also home to a French military base and\u00a0sits on one quarter of the world's nickel deposits, a mineral which is widely used in batteries.\u00a0", "\"New Caledonia is key to the Pacific aspect of France's Indo-Pacific strategy,\"\u00a0Mr\u00a0Dayant said."]
